description: Lesotho has on Wednesday (March 18) declared the coronavirus a national emergency and schools will be closed but public primary schools will continue feeding schemes where some pupils get their only meal. schools will be closed until 17 April. UPDATE: The original total school closure was relaxed to allow some external classes. According to Public Health (COVID-19) Regulations, 2020 (Legal Notice No. 41 of 2020), schools will only be opened for external classes for Grade 7, Junior Certificate, Grade 11, Lesotho general certificate for secondary education, international general certificate for secondary education, advanced subsidiary, A level and internatonal Baccalaureate

description: Lesotho - the Honourable the Right Prime Minister Dr. Motsoahae Thomas Thabane, acting in accordance of the Advice of the Council of State has declared that a state of emergency exists in the Kingdom of Lesotho in respect of the COVID-19 pandemic which threatens the lives of people of Lesotho from Wednesday, 15th April 2020 to Tuesday 28th April 2020.

description: Lesotho closes borders with South Africa for everyone except for those who transport food and medical items. UPDATE: Following the extension of the lockdown from 22 April until the 5th of May 2020, the government has announced that all borders will remain closed. The flow of people into or out of the country is prohibited for this period of time.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Foreign tourists in the country during the lockdown extension may be subject to COVID-19 screening, quarantine, and isolation at their own cost.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
In Lesotho- a person allowed to enter the country during the period of lockdown shall be subjected to a screening process at the designated point of entry. 
-Screening shall be done on people who had travelled to affected countries, contacts of infected people and randomly to general public, 
-Any health personal who has been exposed to a confirmed case of COVID-19 shall be subjected to testing and self-isolation
 -All person providing essential services, obtaining essential services or seeking medical attention within Lesotho, may be subjected to screening. 
Period for which these regulations apply, from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Lesotho opens more border posts for the return of foreign mineworkers. As reported by Mining Weekly, 12 000 mineworkers had one border post at their disposal upon re-entering South Africa from Lesotho and the opening of more border posts was requestedMinerals the Council South Africa environment, health and legacies senior executive Nikisi Lesufi saideach of the three Lesotho border posts had a re-entry processing capacity of 130 to 150 people a day.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: All countries

description: For those entering country during the period of lockdown, those who have travelled, healthcare personnel who have been exposed to confirmed cases, and anyone else may be subjected to screening for COVID-19 by an "enforcement officer". Non-compliance may result in fines and/or imprisonment, as specified on pages 551 to 552. A penalty for an offence where no penalty is outlined shall be a fine not exceeding 5,000 Maloti or imprisonment for a period not exceeding 1 month or both.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Lesotho’s borders are still closed except for all but essential trade. SAA Airlink flights between Maseru and Johannesburg Airport have been suspended.  Moshoeshoe International Airport and the border crossing points at Maseru Bridge, Caledonspoort (Butha Buthe), Maputsoe Bridge, Qacha’s Nek Bridge, and Vanrooyens Gate (Mafeteng) remain open, but with reduced operating hours, for the conveyance of essential goods and services only. With approval from the Ministry of Home Affairs, entry and exit to Lesotho is allowed to provide or receive emergency medical services for a life-threatening condition.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: No persons are allowed into or out of Lesotho during the period of lockdown. All borders of Lesotho shall be closed" with exemptions at designated points of entry. description: Negative PCR test required upon entry. Individuals wishing to enter or exit Lesotho will require a negative COVID-19 test, taken no more than 72 hours before their arrival and will be required to self isolate at their permanent or temporary place of residence for 14 days.

description: The Government of Lesotho has implemented enhanced screening and quarantine measures to reduce the spread of COVID-19.  Travelers should be prepared for additional travel restrictions to be put into effect with little or no advance notice.  Travelers arriving at Moshoeshoe International Airport with no fever (body temperature under 37.5 degrees Celsius/99.5 degrees Fahrenheit) from countries affected by COVID-19 (including the United States) may be instructed by the government of Lesotho to self-isolate for 14 days.

date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Personal Grooming Businesses (e.g. hair salons)") is closed/locked down

description:
In Lesotho, all business and other entities shall cease operations during the lockdown period except for any business or entity involved in manufacturing, supply or provision of essential goods and services.
- 
Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: In Lesotho, any places or premise where cultural, sporting, entertainment, recreational, exhibitional, organizational or similar activities are closed to the public. such as- Public Parks and Swimming Pools; Night Clubs; Casinos; Youth Hostel; Discotheque from May 6 to May 19 2020

description: The government of Lesotho has announced that businesses should ensure, where necessary, that employees wear protective gloves and surgical or N95 masks to prevent the spread of COVID-19. This is in conjunction with the announcement that businesses, where necessary, organize their workers in shifts to maintain social distancing. Businesses must also mandate mask-wearing by customers on their premises

description:
In Lesotho- all gatherings are prohibited except a funeral services of not more than 50 people and a person holding the funeral shall ensure that all safety measures are strictly adhered to.

Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Lesotho- all gatherings are prohibited except a funeral services of not more than 50 people and a person holding the funeral shall ensure that all safety measures are strictly adhered to.

Period for which these regulations apply, being from the period from 22nd April, 2020 to the 5th May, 2020 UPDATE: The restriction of mass gatherings (besides funerals limited to 50 people or less) has been extended. The original restriction was until the 5th of May. Mass gatherings are now restricted for a further 14 days, until the 19th of May 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Lesotho- all gatherings are prohibited except a funeral and religious services of not more than 50 people and a person holding the services shall ensure that all WHO hygiene and safety measures to COVID-19 are strictly adhered to.
Period for which these regulations apply: 6 May to 19 May 2020 UPDATE: The original restriction exempted funeral services from mass gathering restrictions, it has been updated to include funeral and religious services.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The government has announced that from midnight on July 16th 2020, only five people may attend wedding ceremonies.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 15th of July 2020, the government of Lesotho announced the following restrictions on mass gatherings. The following gatherings have been banned: churches, sporting events (except for non-contact sports like golf), political rallies, and any other public gathering not intended for public awareness campaigns.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

description: On the 5th of May 2020, the government of Lesotho has forbidden visits by the general public to the following facilities: isolation and quarantine facilities, hospitals, Ministry of Social Development facilities like youth centres and shelters, correctional centres, holding cells and military detention facilities. This is effective to at least the 19th of May 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Minister of Education and Training of the Kingdom of Lesotho says that schools will open on January 04, 2021 (Monday) as has been set but it will be grades 10 and 11 as well as forms C and E only. In addition, he further noted (on the 3rd of January 2021) that wearing of masks is compulsory at schools and therefore urged parents and guardians to provide children with masks and to encourage them to use them at all times.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education
